definition-item.definition-title: SAFES OR STRONG-ROOMS FOR VALUABLES; BANK PROTECTION DEVICES; SAFETY TRANSACTION PARTITIONS ({devices to prevent theft of bags, trunks or baskets A45C13/18;} alarm arrangements per se G08B)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Portable or fixed safes and strong-rooms for keeping valuables including details such as wall structure, alarms and repellent or fire-extinguishing material releasing devices for such safes and strong-rooms.
Also covered are bank protection devices, such as entrance control or trapping mechanisms, and safety transaction partitions such as barriers for bank teller windows.

list-item.paragraph-text: Alarm arrangements per se in G08B
Devices to prevent theft of bags in A45C
Closure fasteners and locks in E05B
Identification and/or incapacitation of burglars and thieves in G08B

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bank buildings in general
Buildings resistant to earthquake or war-like action

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices to prevent theft of bags, trunks or baskets
Non-safety paying counters
Secure transfers between a building and a vehicle
Floatable safes
Protective closures against war-like action

section-body.paragraph-text: Portable or fixed safes and strong-rooms for keeping valuables including details of such safes and strong-rooms: E05G1/00.
Bank protection devices: E05G5/00.
Safety transaction partitions: E05G7/00.

The main group E05G1/00 contains a number of older documents that were classified administratively (in batches). These documents have not yet been reclassified to the sub-groups and are indexed with E05Y2800/00. This index should not be used for classification.
E05G2700/00 is an old indexing scheme. It can be used for search but should not be used for classification.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bank
A building or portion of a building devoted to the safekeeping or exchange of valuables between the "bank" and its customers
Bank protection device
A mechanism in or on a bank for protecting the valuables or repelling attacks by stealth or force

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cashier
Teller

definition-item.definition-title: Safes or strong-rooms for valuables (savings boxes A45C1/12; floatable safes B63C7/30; storage containers without attack or fire-retardant features B65D; bank buildings in general, e.g. modular construction or floor plan, E04H1/06; buildings resistant to earthquakes or war action E04H9/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Portable or fixed safes and strong-rooms for keeping valuables including details such as wall structure, alarms and repellent or fire-extinguishing material releasing devices for such safes and strong-rooms.

list-item.paragraph-text: Alarm arrangements per se in G08B
Devices to prevent theft of bags in A45C
Closure fasteners and locks in E05B
Identification and/or incapacitation of burglars and thieves in G08B

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Savings boxes
Floatable safes
Containers for storage
Bank buildings in general
Buildings resistant to earthquake or war-like action

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protective closures against war-like action

section-body.paragraph-text: Safes and strong-rooms as well as details such as wall structure, closures, and compartments: E05G1/00 - E05G1/08.
Alarms or other indicators for safes and strong-rooms: E05G1/10.
Fluent material, e.g. repellent or fire-extinguishing material, releasing devices for safes and strong-rooms: E05G1/12.

Furthermore, it is noted that the main group E05G1/00 contains a large number of older documents that were classified administratively. These documents have not yet been reclassified to the sub-groups of E05G1/00 and are indexed with E05Y2800/00. The presence of these documents should not be construed as an indicator to classify similar documents in E05G1/00. Rather, the sub-groups always take precedence.

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: {Portable strong boxes, e.g. which may be fixed to a wall or the like (E05G1/08, E05G1/14 take precedence; devices to prevent theft or loss of bags, trunks, baskets, or the like A45C13/18; coin boxes for coin freed apparatus G07F9/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Portable safes and strong-boxes for keeping valuables, e.g. armoured carrying cases, cash cassettes and small safes which may be attached to a supporting structure.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Strong boxes with multiple, individually secured compartments
Strong boxes with means for masking or destroying the valuables

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices to prevent theft of bags, trunks, baskets or the like
Coin boxes for coin freed apparatus

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details, such as wall or panel structure, doors and fasteners, of safes and strong-rooms for valuables.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Hinges for safes

definition-item.definition-title: Closures (protective doors, windows, or like closures against air raid or other war-like action E06B5/10; shutters, movable grilles, other safety closures E06B9/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Protective doors, windows, or like closures against air raid or other war-like action
Shutters, movable grilles, other safety closures

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fasteners for doors or other closures of safes or strong-rooms for valuables. e.g. safe locking arrangements, bolts.
Locks in E05B

definition-item.definition-title: with alarm, signal or indicator ({E05G1/14 takes precedence}; burglar, theft or intruder alarm per se G08B13/00; fire or explosion alarm per se G08B17/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Strong boxes with means for masking or destroying the valuables

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Burglar, theft or intruder alarm per se
Fire or explosion alarm per se

definition-item.definition-title: with fluent-material releasing, generating or distributing means, e.g. fire-retardant or fire extinguishing means (E05G1/14 takes precedence; identifying, scaring or incapacitating burglars, thieves or intruders with smoke, gas, powder or liquid G08B15/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Safes and strong-rooms for valuables featuring arrangements for generating, releasing and/or distributing fluent materials such as for fire extinguishing or burglar repelling.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Strong boxes with means for masking or destroying the valuables
Identifying, scaring or incapacitating burglars, thieves or intruders with smoke, gas, powder or liquid

definition-item.definition-title: Bank protection devices (E05G1/12, E05G7/00 take precedence; closed circuit television systems H04N7/18)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices and arrangements for the protection of banks by control of ingress and egress to the bank as well as control of valuables in case of hold-up. The group includes entrance control systems, transaction security booths, trapping mechanisms and access sluices.

list-item.paragraph-text: Devices to prevent theft of bags in A45C
Identification and/or incapacitation of burglars and thieves in G08B

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Safes or strong-rooms with fluent material releasing, generating or distributing means, e.g. repellent or fire extinguishing
Safety transaction partitions such as movable pay-plates and bank drive-up windows

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closed circuit television systems
Entrance control systems and access sluices
Cashier's counters
Trapping or confining mechanisms, transaction security booths

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Entrance control systems and access sluices for bank and valuables protection including security doors, turnstiles, cages and respective sensors and control systems.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Trapping or confining mechanisms such as transaction security booths

definition-item.definition-title: Trapping or confining mechanisms, {e.g. transaction security booths} (thief or burglar incapacitating means in general G08B15/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Trapping or confining mechanisms and transaction security booths for bank and valuables protection.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Thief or burglar incapacitating means in general

definition-item.definition-title: Safety transaction partitions, e.g. movable pay-plates; {Bank drive-up windows} (non-safety paying counters, e.g. for supermarkets A47F9/02; {secure depositories for food A47G29/14; secure transfers between a building and a vehicle B60P3/03})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices and arrangements to secure safety during transactions of valuables, such as bank depositories and security devices for bank teller windows.

list-item.paragraph-text: Alarm arrangements per se in G08B
Devices to prevent theft of bags in A45C
Closure fasteners and locks in E05B
Identification and/or incapacitation of burglars and thieves in G08B

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Non-safety paying counters
Secure depositories for food
Secure transfers between a building and a vehicle

abbreviations.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following abbreviations are often used:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cashier
Teller

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Bank depositories such as night safes and safe-deposit boxes.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Automatic safe-deposit box systems with multiple compartments

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Movable security barriers for bank teller windows.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pass-boxes for security barriers in bank teller windows, e.g. with stationary, rotatable or sliding bottoms
